newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian call market inactive as Bombay banks shut.
newsitem.headline: Indian call market inactive as Bombay banks shut.

text.p: India's call money market was inactive on Thursday as banks in Bombay, the financial centre, were closed for a holiday. Banks in other key cities are open.
Overnight call rates closed at 10.0 percent on Wednesday, down from the day's opening quotes of 10.50-10.75 percent. Stray deals were also reported at below 10 percent, dealers said.

Banks in Bombay reopen on Friday. Most dealers expect call rates to continue in the 10.0-11.0 percent range next week. The rates are unlikely to breach 11 percent because of availability of Reserve Bank of India refinance credit at 11 percent.
